title: Executive Order 7931-Exemption of Marion C. Hargrove From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that Marion C. Hargrove, purchasing officer, Government of the District of Columbia, who during the month of November 1938, will reach the retirement age prescribed for automatic separation from the service, applicable to him, be exempted from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), I hereby exempt the said Marion C. Hargrove from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending November 30, 1939.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 7931-Exemption of Marion C. Hargrove From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362905
